channel.title: Datastorage on Robot Librarian
channel.description: Recent content in Datastorage on Robot Librarian

item.title: JSON, JSON everywhere
item.description: Via Ajaxian, just saw an announcement for Persevere, a network-centric, JSON-based generic storage engine. It features: A REST-based interface over regular old HTTP JSON as the native data going in and out, including circular references and such Search interface based around JSONPath RPC interface based on JSON-RPC Seemingly buzzword compliant across the board I’ve been thinking about these sorts of servers a lot lately (couchdb and strokedb are two others) in the context of the “not-the-catalog” data we track here at the library.
